data.title: Best food in Homestead/all of the Keys!
data.text: Amazing food! As a family we had the goat, fried pork, oxtail, empanadas, festivals, spicy wings and the potatoe pudding. Pretty much 1/3 the menu. It was all fantastic. We had the polenta, rice and beans and the plantains and this was all fantastic. Best festivals I have ever had and the goat was so succulent. I grew up around Jamaican food and this was hands down the best ever. My gf has had goat curry from Ghana, Barbados and Trinidad & Tobago, and she confirmed this was the best she's ever had. The Haitian Jamaican flavours are truly spectacular. I should also mention JP is an amazing host who takes his time to make you feel at home and goes trough the menu with you to answer any questions you may have.  If you're on your way to the Keys, or hell, live in Homestead , You must check this place out!

data.title: Best Hole-in-the-wall restaurant ever!
data.text: We had take out and sampled the legume beef before ordering and that sold us.  Food was excellent and quantity was sufficient for 2.  Conch fritters brought us here and will bring us back.  JP was delightful and made several very useful suggestions about local conditions concerning an approaching hurricane.

data.title: Authentic gem
data.text: You will hard pressed to find better Jamaican food. Doesn't look like much, parking sucks but you will never be disappointed.

data.title: Basic Jamaican and Haitian Dishes
data.text: We went with the idea of dining in but it was just too hot so we ordered for take out. Ordered curry goat, oxtail and jerk pork along with Jamaican and Haitian cola champagne and ginger beer. Everything was fresh, meaty AND spicy with whole spicy peppers, just how we like our food!!

data.title: Great Carribean Mix
data.text: The owner and his wife are from Haiti and Jamaica. The mix of spices from those two create some of the most flavorful dishes I've had in a long time. It's tiny but stop by and enjoy the hospitality and warm atmosphere.

data.title: Great alternative to Mexican
data.text:
Nice man, great food.
Interesting large portions of Haitian and Jamaican dishes. 
The owner is a kind, funny character who endears you from the moment you walk through the door. Can't wait to try more of their dishes.

data.title: Great neighborhood find
data.text:
Awesome memorable meals in a small, local venue. Just the kind of place we love to find! The proprietor was so delightful, welcoming,and informative. He really made us feel so welcome, and took such obvious pride in his place. The locals there were so friendly to us (obviously) suburban out of area patrons. 
The Saturday special goat soup was awesome, as were the jerk chicken wings. He was so accommodating to serve the meal family style, so we could mix and match. The sweet sour pork was perfect; the conch fritters were awesome. I didn't get a chance to try the empanadas; although the crane empanadas werent a favorite (Gamy, my nephew said; if one likes that) But altogether a great experience if one is open to local adventure in cuisine.

data.title: Fall off the bone delicious
data.text: I ordered take out. I had trouble finding the place (due to my GPS listing the incorrect address). I called and the owner patiently guided me to the restaurant and even came outside to make sure I could see him. I picked up my jerk chicken dinner (for myself) and oxtail dinner (for a friend) and went on my way. Let me tell you: 1) the meat from both dinners fell off of the bone, 2) the jerk was well seasoned, through and through, 3) the oxtail is the best I've ever had (and all this time I wasn't sure if I liked oxtail as much), and 4) the food was ready fast, and 5) the portions were very generous. I highly recommend this place for some very good Jamaican food (haven't tried the Haitian dishes yet).

data.title: Great Hole in Wall
data.text: Our party of seven took over the Yardie Spice Restaurant. The owner explained each meal option and how it was prepared. Answering questions along the way. Once food did begin to arrive it was presented beautifully simple and tasted great. There wasn't a single negative thing said about any of the meals. And to top it off we tried a few of the sorbet desserts. They were great.

data.title: Amazing Jamaican and Haitian food
data.text:
My wife and I stopped by last night for dinner, after reading so many great reviews about this little hole in the wall. Everything was perfect from start to finish. We were greeted promptly by JP. He explained the menu to us very well. We had conch fritters and jerk wings for appetizers and oxtail and the steamed yellow tail snapper for entrees, and we share an orange sorbet. Everything was amazing. 

We will be back!!!

Kudos to JP

data.title: Authentic Caribbean food with Great Service!
data.text: As stated in previous reviews, the owner was our server. He is knowledgeable, friendly, and passionate about the quality of the food. We were hesitant to try the conch fritters because we've not had a good experience with them in the Keys, but the owner was persuasive and I'm so glad he was! The best Conch fritters I've had since Jamaica! We also had the chicken empanada, and again, perfect. For our entrées we had the jerk chicken and goat curry. Have mercy, so perfectly seasoned, tender, and melt in your mouth good. In spite of being pleasantly full, we followed another recommendation and had one of the homemade sorbets. Wow, is all I can say...the pineapple sorbet was light, sweet/tart, and a wonderful end to a great meal. Don't let the outside fool you, this little place serves 5 star, homemade with pride, authentic Jamaican/Haitian cuisine.

data.title: Don't miss this place!
data.text: I've never left a review before, but had to after visiting this place. The food was beyond delicious! The owner was so nice and inviting. He let us sample the polenta since we'd never had it before and it too was amazing! My kids even loved it. We had the curry chicken, jerk chicken, polenta, and empanadas. Don't let the exterior fool you, this place is a must.

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: Lunch! The jerked chicken was great, the chicken soup very very good. So I'm told by the boys... I had the jerked tofu - excellent! Usually the  non-meat options I order are bland ... But not here! The jerked tofu was flavorful and spicy. The atmosphere is casual and friendly. Five stars!

data.title: Go to enjoy the delicious food
data.text: You are not going here for the atmosphere, but do go for the delicious food and warm hospitality.   The place is tiny and basic, and our GPS had a hard time finding it  for whatever reason (it is just south of Flagler Ave).  But it was worth our persistence to find it.  The owner made us feel very comfortable and at home and the food was outstanding.  The jerk was more about flavor that just searing your taste buds and the flavors danced across the tongue.  The fresh fish was soooo fresh and tasty.  Everything was perfectly prepared and seasoned.  The prices are quite reasonable also, and it appeared they do a lot of takeout.  We left feeling very, very happy.

data.title: Great food and personal service
data.text: My husband and I ate at Yardie Spice restaurant this evening. It's a very small restaurant (it only seats 12). Our waiter was the owner and he could not have been more personable. My husband ordered the jerk chicken ($6.99) for chicken, salad, beans and rice and a fried plantain.  He was in heaven. The chicken literally fell off the bone.  The chicken was spicey but not overpowering. It had just the right amount of kick. I ordered the shrimp ($12.99 with salad, rice and fried plantain)and it was wonderful as well. I don't like spicey food so they toned down the sauce for me. The portions are large. My husband was able to finish his meal but I took 4 shrimp and some rice home with me.   If I lived here, this would be a restaurant that I would choose to eat at frequently.  I don't think you can go wrong with any of the menu items.

data.title: Vraiment excellent !
data.text:
Nous étions de passage dans le coin et nous avions trouvé le restaurant grâce à TripAdvisor et nous en sommes très content ! Un patron super sympa et des plats très bons et très copieux pour un petit prix. 

Et en plus vous aurez du Kompa en ambiance musicale :D

Nous étions 2 végétariens dans le groupe de 6. N'hésitez pas il y a de bonnes choses pour nous également ;)
